result.execSummary:
All charges against Orlando M Pleadwell in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orlando M Pleadwell is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DCPS referral

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing for 20CF3246, 21CF193, 21CM2551 and 22CF1586. Atty Moore gives argument. State gives argument and reads a victim statement. Court makes findings and orders the following: 

20CF3246- Cash bail will be reduced to $1,000.00 with the $500.00 cash that was already posted to be applied to bail. Court orders DCPS for GPS (previously ordered). ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME. 

21CF193- Cash bail will be reduced to $1,000.00 with the $500.00 cash that was already posted to be applied to bail. Court orders DCPS for GPS (previously ordered). ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME. 

21CM2551- Cash bail will be reduced to $1,000.00 with the $500.00 cash that was already posted to be applied to bail. Court orders DCPS for GPS (previously ordered). ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME. 

22CF1586- Cash bail will be reduced to $500.00. Court orders DCPS for GPS (previously ordered). ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
